intro: Hylomecon japonica var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese hylomecon, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. The plant has a short stature, usually reaching only a few centimeters in height.
